intro: Carlemannia sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran carlemannia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Indonesian island of Sumatra. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth surface, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. Due to habitat loss, Carlemannia sumatrana is considered a rare and endangered species.
